medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive dyspnea and decreased exercise tolerance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 years prior with slight decrease in exercise tolerance. Over 6 months, dyspnea on exertion progressively increased, followed by an episode of hemoptysis. Wheezing developed with a chronic cough productive of clear-to-green sputum. Shortness of breath intensified over the next 2 months, with the patient able to walk only 5 to 6 meters before requiring rest.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of albinism, easy bruisability, and near-sightedness. Mild shortness of breath for many years. Allergic to shellfish. No known medication allergies except avoidance of aspirin due to bleeding problems.
medical_history.family_history: Mother was told that he might have cystic fibrosis. Many family members had asthma; two siblings had albinism and milder respiratory problems.
medical_history.social_history: Of Puerto Rican ancestry, lives with a female partner and their child. Stopped attending school due to illness and is unemployed. Occasionally drinks alcohol and has a 10-pack-year smoking history, stopped approximately 9 months prior.
